@notice Query whether a certain address is a validator.
 @dev Also used by the stream contract onlyValidator modifier.

requestStream

nodes.documentation:
@notice Manager can review stream requests, add extra data and approve them.
 @dev Can provide an empty input chunk id array; these can be added later by calling addInputChunkId.
nodes.name: approveStreamCreation

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,address,uint256[] memory,uint256[] memory,string memory) returns (contract Stream)

nodes.documentation:
@notice After approval the client can create the stream. Also the client needs 
 to fund the escrow on creation.
nodes.name: createStream

nodes.documentation:
@notice Pushes a new input chunk id to given stream
 @dev Called by manager for now. Method is called as input chunk ids are created

nodes.documentation:
@notice Signals that a stream has ended and no more input chunks are available
 @dev Called by manager or client(owner)

addInputChunkId(uint256,uint256).details: Called by manager for now. Method is called as input chunk ids are created

approveStreamCreation(uint256,uint256[]).details: Can provide an empty input chunk id array; these can be added later by calling addInputChunkId.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

isValidator(address).details: Also used by the stream contract onlyValidator modifier.

refundAllowed(uint256).details: TODO: make refund a timelock maybe?Called by stream/escrow contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

requestStream(uint256,string,uint256[]).details: Each request is assigned an id based on the RTPM & client addres.  The stream id is generated later by the manager and is added when approveStreamCreation is called.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

addInputChunkId(uint256,uint256).notice: Pushes a new input chunk id to given stream

approveStreamCreation(uint256,uint256[]).notice: Manager can review stream requests, add extra data and approve them.

createStream(uint256).notice: After approval the client can create the stream. Also the client needs  to fund the escrow on creation.

endStream(uint256).notice: Signals that a stream has ended and no more input chunks are available

isValidator(address).notice: Query whether a certain address is a validator.

refundAllowed(uint256).notice: Can check whether a client can refunds the coins from a stream contract.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.
